Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket server using the org.java_websocket library to handle client connections, messages, disconnections, and errors.

Class Description: MyWebSocketServer is a custom WebSocket server implementation that extends the WebSocketServer class from the org.java_websocket library. It provides lifecycle methods for managing client connections and communication.

Attributes:
- countServerLatch: CountDownLatch - A synchronization aid that allows one or more threads to wait until a set of operations being performed in other threads completes.

Methods:
- MyWebSocketServer(int port, CountDownLatch serverDownLatch) -> None - Constructor that initializes the WebSocket server with the specified port and CountDownLatch.
- onOpen(WebSocket conn, ClientHandshake handshake) -> None - Called when a new client connection is established.
- onClose(WebSocket conn, int code, String reason, boolean remote) -> None - Called when a client connection is closed.
- onMessage(WebSocket conn, String message) -> None - Called when a message is received from a client.
- onError(WebSocket conn, Exception ex) -> None - Called when an error occurs.
- onStart() -> None - Called when the server starts successfully.
